Corkscrew as a DIY candle: You can attach a tealight candle to a cork stopper and insert it into the bottle. Use a knife to evenly score the bottle and add a wick to make it a simple but unique candle.
Corkscrew as a bookmark: You can use a cork to hold your place in a book. Slide it between the pages, keeping the cork on top, and use it as a reminder of where you left off.
Corkscrew as a key chain: You can use a cork and a key ring to create a unique key chain that adds flair to your keys.
Corkscrew as a plant marker: You can use a cork and a string to label potted plants in your garden. Write the name of each plant on the cork and stake it into the ground or attach it to the pot.
Corkscrew as a measuring tool: You can use the stem of a corkscrew and a string to create a rudimentary ruler for taking measurements or measuring the diameter of objects.
